trans-unit.source: Provides a control array of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser"></xref> controls
The `WebBrowserArray` class provides an equivalent for the run-time functionality of a Visual Basic 6.0 `WebBrowser` array.
It does not provide the design-time features of a Visual Basic 6.0 control array.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.WebBrowserArray"></xref> class.

When you instantiate a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.WebBrowserArray>, you must also call the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.WebBrowserArray.SetIndex%2A> method to create the initial element in the array.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.WebBrowserArray"></xref> class, specifying its container.

When you instantiate a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.WebBrowserArray>, you must also call the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.WebBrowserArray.SetIndex%2A> method to create the initial element in the array.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IContainer"></xref> where the control array will be hosted.
Gets a value that determines whether a control is a member of a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.WebBrowserArray"></xref>.
The `CanExtend` method can be used to determine whether a specific <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser> control is the base element of the control array from which the other elements were cloned.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser"></xref> control.
`true` if target is a member of the control array; otherwise `false`.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.CausesValidation"></xref> property changes.
This event is raised if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.CausesValidation%2A> property is changed by either a programmatic modification or user interaction.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser"></xref> control finishes loading a document.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser> control navigates to a new document whenever one of the following properties is set or methods is called:
Handle the `DocumentCompleted` event to receive notification when the new document finishes loading.

When the `DocumentCompleted` event occurs, the new document is fully loaded, which means you can access its contents through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser.Document%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser.DocumentText%2A>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser.DocumentStream%2A> property.
To receive notification before navigation starts, handle the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.WebBrowserArray.Navigating> event.
Handling this event lets you cancel navigation if certain conditions have not been met, for example, when the user has not completely filled out a form.

Handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser.Navigated> event to receive notification when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser> control finishes navigation and has begun loading the document at the new location.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser"></xref> control downloads a file.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

Overrides <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.GetControlInstanceType"></xref>.
This method cannot be called from your application's code.
Use the <xref:System.Object.GetType%2A> method instead.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].

The type of a control in a control array.
Gets the index of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser"></xref> in a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.WebBrowserArray"></xref>.
This method can be used to retrieve the index for the specified <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser>.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].

A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser"></xref> in the control array.
A `Short` that represents the index of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser"></xref>.
Overrides <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.HookUpControlEvents(System.Object)"></xref>.
This method cannot be called from your application's code.
Use `AddHandler` to hook up events for any controls that are added by using the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.Load%2A> method.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
Gets a specific element of a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.WebBrowserArray"></xref> by index.
Read-only.
The `Item` property is the default property for a control array.
Therefore, the following lines of code are equivalent.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A `Short` that specifies the position of an element of the control array.
A at the specified Index in the control array.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Location"></xref> property changes.
This event is raised if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Location%2A> property is changed by either a programmatic modification or user interaction.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Margin"></xref> property changes.
This event is raised if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Margin%2A> property is changed by either a programmatic modification or user interaction.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Occurs when the control is moved.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser"></xref> control has navigated to a new document and has begun loading it.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser> control navigates to a new document whenever one of the following properties is set or methods is called:
Handle the `Navigated` event to receive notification when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser> control has navigated to a new document.

When the `Navigated` event occurs, the new document has begun loading, which means you can access the loaded content through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser.Document%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser.DocumentText%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser.DocumentStream%2A> properties.

Handle the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.WebBrowserArray.DocumentCompleted> event to receive notification when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser> control finishes loading the new document.
You can also receive notification before navigation starts by handling the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.WebBrowserArray.Navigating> event.
Handling this event lets you cancel navigation if certain conditions have not been met, for example, the user has not filled out a form.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Occurs before the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser"></xref> control navigates to a new document.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser> control navigates to a new document whenever one of the following properties is set or methods is called:
You can handle the `Navigating` event to cancel navigation if certain conditions have not been met, for example, when the user has not completely filled out a form.
To cancel navigation, set the `Cancel` property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowserNavigatingEventArgs> object passed to the event handler to `true`.
You can also use this object to retrieve the URL of the new document through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowserNavigatingEventArgs.Url%2A> property.
If the new document will be displayed in a Web page frame, you can retrieve the name of the frame through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowserNavigatingEventArgs.TargetFrameName%2A> property.

Handle the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.WebBrowserArray.Navigated> event to receive notification when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser> control finishes navigation and has begun loading the document at the new location.

Handle the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.WebBrowserArray.DocumentCompleted> event to receive notification when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser> control finishes loading the new document.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Occurs before a new browser window is opened.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser> control opens a separate browser window when the appropriate overload of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser.Navigate%2A> method is called or when the user clicks **Open in New Window** on the browser shortcut menu when the mouse pointer hovers over a hyperlink.
You can disable the shortcut menu by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser.IsWebBrowserContextMenuEnabled%2A> property to `false`.
The `NewWindow` event occurs before the new browser window is opened.
You can handle this event, for example, to prevent the window from opening when certain conditions have not been met.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Occurs when the control's <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Parent"></xref> property changes.
This event is raised if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Parent%2A> property is changed by either a programmatic modification or user interaction.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser"></xref> control has updated information about the download progress of a document that it is navigating to.
You can use a handler for this event to implement a navigation progress bar similar to the one in Internet Explorer.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowserProgressChangedEventArgs.CurrentProgress%2A> property to determine the number of bytes that have been downloaded successfully.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowserProgressChangedEventArgs.MaximumProgress%2A> property to determine the total number of bytes available for downloading.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Region"></xref> property changes.
This event is raised if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Region%2A> property is changed by either a programmatic modification or user interaction.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
The `ResetIndex` method is not supported in the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.WebBrowserArray"></xref> class.
This method is not supported, and calling it does not raise an exception.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref>.
Occurs when the control is resized.

To determine the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Size%2A> of the resized control, you can cast the `sender` parameter of the <xref:System.EventArgs> data to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> and get its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Size%2A> property (or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Height%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Width%2A> properties individually).
To handle custom layouts, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowserBase.Layout> event instead of the `Resize` event.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowserBase.Layout> event is raised in response to a `Resize` event, but also in response to other changes that affect the layout of the control.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Sets the index of the initial <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser"></xref> in a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.WebBrowserArray"></xref>.
The `SetIndex` method should only be called when you are creating the initial element in the control array.
To add subsequent elements, call the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.Load%2A> method and specify the `Index`.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser"></xref> in the control array.
A `Short` that represents the index of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser"></xref>.
Returns a value that indicates whether a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser"></xref> is a member of this <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.WebBrowserArray"></xref>.
If the specified <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser> is a member of a different <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.WebBrowserArray>, `ShouldSerializeIndex` returns `false`.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser"></xref> in the control array.
`true` if o is a member of this control array; otherwise, `false`.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Size"></xref> property value changes.
This event is raised if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Size%2A> property is changed by either a programmatic modification or user interaction.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

This event is raised if the <xref:System.Drawing.SystemColors> is changed by either a programmatic modification or user interaction.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

Occurs when the control is finished validating.

When you change the focus by using the keyboard (TAB, SHIFT+TAB, and so on), by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Select%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.SelectNextControl%2A> methods, or by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ContainerControl.ActiveControl%2A> property to the current form, focus events occur in the following order:
When you change the focus by using the mouse or by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Focus%2A> method, focus events occur in the following order:

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.CausesValidation%2A> property is set to `false`, the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.WebBrowserArray.Validating> and `Validated` events are suppressed.

If the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs> is set to `true` in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.WebBrowserArray.Validating> event delegate, all events that would usually occur after the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.WebBrowserArray.Validating> event are suppressed.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
